raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Add ggAVAX to AAVE v3 on Avalanche
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---

Title: [TEMP CHECK] Add ggAVAX to AAVE v3 on Avalanche 

Author: @b_tanyeri Founder at Daybreak Digital, an Avalanche focused crypto fund

Created: 2023-12-08

---

# Summary

This TEMP CHECK proposes to add ggAVAX, a liquid staking token for the Gogopool protocol, to AAVE V3 Avalanche market.

# Motivation

Gogopool is one of the premiere liquid staking protocols on Avalanche. They have over 100 active minipool node operators, and over 250,000 ggAVAX minted on Avalanche’s c-chain. Allowing ggAVAX to be used as collateral with a trusted partner such as AAVE will enhance both ggAVAX liquidity as well as AAVE’s dominance in the Avalanche ecosystem.

# Specification

Project: Gogopool Website
Twitter: Official Twitter
Official Documentation: Docs
ggAVAX contract: ggAVAX Contract
^ please note this is using snowtrace.dev as snowtrace.io is being retired at month end
Balancer: ggAVAX-WAVAX pool

*Note*
ggAVAX enjoys deep liquidity on the c-chain, with over just under $5m in the ggAVAX/WAVAX balancer pool.

In order to create a reliable price feed for ggAVAX for Avalanche for AAVE to utilize, I propose we incorporate the appropriate getRate function from the ggAVAX contract and combine it with existing AVAXUSD chainlink price feeds.

# Next Steps:

1. Gather the AAVE community’s feedback on this proposal.
2. If consensus is reached, escalate this proposal to TEMP CHECK snapshot stage.
3. If TEMP CHECK snapshot outcome is yes, escalate to ARFC.
4. If consensus on ARFC is reached with appropriate technical details added, then escalate to ARFC snapshot.
5. If ARFC snapshot approved, then escalate to AIP Stage.

# Disclosure
I am in investor into the Gogopool protocol. I run minipools and have exposure to both the platform and the GGP token.

This TEMP CHECK is powered by ACI Skywards.
The Aave Chan Initiative has not received any form of compensation for creating this proposal.

# Copyright
Copyright and related rights waived via CC0 .

raw.title: [ARFC] Add FXS to Ethereum V3
raw.author: 0x02fEb744cA516FD6E41D940Ae2d0F7Cb6FCB1ac3
raw.body:
title: [ARFC] Add FXS to Ethereum V3
author: @0xlide + Alice Rozengarden @Alice - Aave-chan initiative
created: 2023-10-13

---

## Summary

This publication presents the community an opportunity to add FXS to the Ethereum Aave v3 Liquidity Pool.

## Motivation

Frax Finance is a DeFi protocol that offers a stable protocol for issuing FRAX/FPI/frxETH and subprotocols such as Fraxlend, Fraxswap, and Fraxferry. The Frax Shares Token ($FXS) serves a dual role as both a governance token and a utility token.

The addition of FXS to Aave V3 represents the introduction of a new asset, encouraging the transition from Aave V2 to V3 and diversifying collateral assets for GHO. Furthermore, Aave DAO can utilize FXS obtained from the pool to kickstart the adoption of GHO and/or new aTokens.

## Specification

The parameters shown below are supported by @Gauntlet and @Chaoslabs with diverging opinions on the LT and LTV

Ticker: FXS
Contract Adress:[0x3432B6A60D23Ca0dFCa7761B7ab56459D9C964D0 ](https://etherscan.io/token/0x3432b6a60d23ca0dfca7761b7ab56459d9c964d0#code)
Chainlink Oracle: [0x6Ebc52C8C1089be9eB3945C4350B68B8E4C2233f](https://etherscan.io/address/0x6ebc52c8c1089be9eb3945c4350b68b8e4c2233f)

| Parameter | Recommendation (Gauntlet) | Recommendation (ChaosLabs) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | YES | YES |
| Borrowable | YES | YES |
| Collateral Enabled | YES | YES |
| Supply Cap (FXS) | 800,000 | 800,000 |
| Borrow Cap (FXS) | 500,000 | 500,000 |
| Debt Ceiling | $4M | $4M |
| **LTV** | **35.00%** | **50.00%** |
| **LT** | **45.00%** | **60.00%** |
| Liquidation Bonus | 10.00% | 10.00% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00% | 10.00% |
| Reserve Factor | 20.00% | 20.00% |
| Base Variable Borrow Rate | 0.00% | 0.00% |
| Variable Slope 1 | 9.00% | 9.00% |
| Variable Slope 2 | 300.00% | 300.00% |
| Uoptimal | 45.00% | 45.00% |
| Stable Borrowing | NO | NO |
| Stable Slope1 | 13.00% | 13.00% |
| Stable Slope2 | 300.00% | 300.00% |
| Base Stable Rate Offset | 3.00% | 3.00% |
| Stable Rate Excess Offset | 5.00% | 5.00% |
| Optimal Stable To Total Debt Ratio | 20.00% | 20.00% |
| Flahloanable | YES | YES |
| Siloed Borrowing | NO | NO |
| Borrowable in Isolation | NO | NO |

## Next Step

The following steps are as follow:
- If said snapshot is successful, escalate to an AIP.

## Disclaimer

The author is not presenting this ARFC on behalf of any third party and is not compensated by Frax for creating this proposal.

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via CC0.

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] stEUR Onboarding on Aave V3 Ethereum Pool
raw.author: 0x57ab7ee15cE5ECacB1aB84EE42D5A9d0d8112922
raw.body:
---
title: [TEMP CHECK] stEUR Onboarding on Aave V3 Ethereum Pool
author: @marczeller - Aave-chan Initiative
date: 09-10-2023
---

## Summary

This TEMP CHECK proposes the onboarding of stEUR as a collateral-only asset on the Aave V3 Ethereum Pool. stEUR represents staked agEUR, a decentralized EUR-peg stablecoin minted by the Angle Protocol.

## Motivation

- **Decentralized Stablecoin Diversity**: At the ACI, we support the diversity of decentralized stablecoins. EUR stablecoins, in particular, are underrepresented in the ecosystem, and onboarding stEUR can help bridge this gap.
  
- **Growth in a Controlled Environment**: While stEUR and agEUR have relatively small market caps (5M$ and 20M$ respectively), onboarding stEUR as a collateral-only asset with limited caps will allow it to grow in a controlled environment, minimizing risks for the Aave protocol.

- **Collateral Potential**: stEUR, being a staked version of a decentralized EUR-peg stablecoin, presents a promising collateral candidate for Aave.

## Specification

- **Asset**: stEUR
- **Contract Address**: 0x004626A008B1aCdC4c74ab51644093b155e59A23

### Price Feed

For the price feed, we propose implementing a price adapter that calculates the value of stEUR based on the value of agEUR/USD and the exchange rate of agEUR/stEUR.

This replicates precedents such as with [sDAI](https://etherscan.io/address/0x29081f7aB5a644716EfcDC10D5c926c5fEe9F72B#code).

### Risk Parameters

We propose the following parameters for stEUR onboarding:

| Parameter             | Value       |
|-----------------------|-------------|
| Isolation Mode        | No          |
| Borrowable            | No          |
| Borrowable in Iso     | No          |
| Stable Borrowing      | No          |
| Collateral Enabled    | Yes         |
| Supply Cap (stEUR)    | 3,000,000   |
| Borrow Cap (stEUR)    | 0           |
| Debt Ceiling          | N/A         |
| LTV                   | 70%         |
| LT                    | 75%         |
| LB                    | 8%          |
| LPF                   | 10%         |
| Reserve Factor        | 20%         |
| Base Rate             | 0%          |
| Slope 1               | 8%          |
| Slope 2               | 80%         |
| Optimal Ratio         | 80%         |

## Next Steps

1. If TEMP CHECK snapshot outcome is YAE, escalate to ARFC stage.
4. If consensus on ARFC stage is reached and risk service providers provided feedback on risk parameters, escalate to ARFC snapshot stage.
5. If ARFC snapshot stage outcome is YAE, escalate to AIP stage.

## Disclaimer

The Aave-chan Initiative is not presenting this TEMP CHECK on behalf of any third party and is not compensated by Angle for creating this TEMP CHECK.

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via CC0.

cleaned.title: [ARFC] Update GNO Risk Parameters on Aave V3 Gnosis Pool
cleaned.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193

raw.title: [ARFC] Update GNO Risk Parameters on Aave V3 Gnosis Pool
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---

Title: [ARFC] Update GNO Risk Parameters on Aave V3 Gnosis Pool

Author: @marczeller - Aave Chan Initiative

Created: 2023-11-20

---

# Summary

This ARFC proposes to update GNO risk parameters on the Aave V3 Gnosis Pool to enable borrowing, fostering Gnosischain decentralization and use-cases for passive income and staking.

# Motivation

The goal is to enhance GNO utility by allowing it to be a borrowable asset, thereby supporting Gnosischain’s decentralization. This adjustment also prepares for future GNO LSTs and a possible GNO-correlated e-mode, expanding utility and passive income opportunities for GNO holders.

# Specification

The proposed changes aim to make GNO a borrowable asset outside of isolation mode with adjusted risk parameters to accommodate this new functionality

 
![Risk Parameters GNO.png](ipfs://bafkreid4sdglcnp3fyzrldvidk5yw2f2nljgz63uh25vz66yyct6n2bkoi)
    

 
![14fb075b51531225496e4e327c20ed0902a78b26.png](ipfs://bafkreig6kyhsilwqhjglqr6yuf2egn2kpf5moh6vdccu3q72ph4pzfc56i)
    
# Next Steps

- Collect feedback from the Aave community & Aave Risk service provider on the proposed changes.
- If the community feedback is positive, advance the proposal to the ARFC Snapshot phase.
- Upon successful Snapshot, implement the updated risk parameters via an AIP vote.

# Disclaimer

This proposal is powered by Skywards.
The Aave Chan Initiative has not received any form of compensation from Gnosis for creating this proposal.

# Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.title: [ARFC] Add fUSDC to Ethereum v3
raw.author: 0x329c54289Ff5D6B7b7daE13592C6B1EDA1543eD4
raw.body:
---
title: [ARFC] Add fUSDC to Ethereum v3
author: @marczeller - Aave-Chan Initiative
created: 2023-05-23
---

## Summary

This ARFC presents the community with the opportunity to add fUSDC to the Ethereum v3 Liquidity Pool.

## Abstract

fUSDC is a yield-bearing token representing USDC deposits in Flux, a fork of Compound V2. Adding fUSDC to Ethereum v3 would allow fUSDC holders to borrow stablecoins on Aave and leverage their fUSDC position, boosting the stablecoin utilization rate on Aave, while attracting new stablecoin deposits thanks to boosted supply rates.

## Motivation

fUSDC is a new financial primitive with arguably the best risk-adjusted yield available in DeFi. Adding support for fUSDC on Ethereum V3 in isolated mode would allow fUSDC holders to borrow stablecoins on Aave and leverage their fUSDC position, boosting the stablecoin utilization rate on Aave, while attracting new stablecoin deposits thanks to boosted supply rates.

## Specification

Ticker: fUSDC

Contract Address: `[0x465a5a630482f3abd6d3b84b39b29b07214d19e5](https://etherscan.io/address/0x465a5a630482f3abd6d3b84b39b29b07214d19e5)`

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | Yes |
| Borrowable | No |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes |
| Supply Cap | 220M (~$4.45M) |
| Borrow Cap | N/A |
| Debt Ceiling | $1M |
| LTV | 77% |
| LT | 79% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 4.5% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 20% |
| Variable Base | 0.00% |
| Variable Slope1 | 4.00% |
| Variable Slope2 | 60.00% |
| Uoptimal | 90.00% |
| Reserve Factor | 10.00% |
| Stable Borrowing | Disabled |

## Next Steps

- If the ARFC snapshot vote passes, move the proposal to the Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP) stage for final approval and implementation.

## Disclaimer

@marczeller and the Aave-Chan Initiative are not associated with or compensated by Flux Finance for publishing this AFRC.

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

decision.summary: Proposal to add sFRAX as collateral to Aave V3 Ethereum pool to increase borrow demand. Voting timeline shows strong and stable early support for YAE option. Forum discussion mixed but includes strong support. Similar past proposals mostly passed with positive market effects. Slight negative market impact here, but vote and timeline data support change.
key_arguments_for: Strong and stable voting timeline lead for YAE option
sFRAX integration can increase demand for borrowable assets like stablecoins and FXS
Similar past proposals to add assets to Aave V3 had positive vote outcomes and market impacts
Forum comments include explicit support and community engagement
key_arguments_against: Slight negative market price and TVL impact observed post-vote
Some forum comments expressed concerns or negative sentiment
Risk parameters for sFRAX will be detailed in later ARFC stage, currently unknown

evidence.quote: First comment summarized proposal and was negative in sentiment; second comment expressed full support.
Timeline metrics show perfect lead ratio and stability for YAE option.
Similar past proposals mostly passed with YAE option and showed positive market impacts.

decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• The voting timeline is highly stable and consistent with unanimous early support for the YAE option, indicating strong community backing.
• Forum sentiment is mixed with some negative and neutral comments, but key early comments show clear support, suggesting the vote broadly reflects community views.
• Similar past proposals to add assets to Aave V3 mostly resulted in successful adoption and positive market responses, supporting the case for change.
• Despite slight negative price and TVL impacts post-vote, these should not outweigh the clear voting and timeline data favoring integration, especially given risk parameters will be addressed in subsequent stages.
• Overall, the recommendation to select YAE and proceed with change aligns with voting dynamics and community sentiment, promoting the organization’s durable benefit.
